channel.title: (Yet Another) Noble Rework [For Less Confirmability]
channel.description:
The intent of this rework suggestion is to make Noble less confirmable. Regardless of how fun and useful I think the current Political Pressure is, its primary use is for reliable confirmation. And in Cult games, Noble Twin is mainly used to confirm the Noble claim is not an Apostle.
># [color=steblue]**The Noble**[/color] >[color=steblue]**Blue Dragon Social**[/color] > >**Royal Blood (Passive)** - Votes to elect you King count as two. > >**Gossip (Night)** - See the feedback of abilities used on target player. Will not receive feedback for conversion, attacks or Evil Support abilities that reveal the person as evil. (Infinite uses) >**Maid Spy (Night)** - See the contents of all whispers tomorrow. (2 uses) > >**Noble Twin (Day)** - Your vote for execution or pardon will count twice. Nobody will be notified unless this ability changes the outcome of the trial. (2 uses) >**Political Pressure (Day)** - Force all abstainers to vote the same as yourself. Nobody will be notified unless this ability changes the outcome of the trial. (1 use)
Of course both of the new day abilities can _technically_ still confirm a Noble. But that comes at the price of an extremely high risk of a mislynch.
I don't know if this new Political Pressure would result in a meta of nobody ever abstaining. If that were to happen I'd rather remove it entirely than revert it to the current one.
Making Noble Twin single use but count as 3 votes is also something to consider.

item.title: (Yet Another) Noble Rework [For Less Confirmability]
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
I can’t think of an ability but what if we gave him Noble Twin permanent passive? Which of course would not notify anyone unless it affected outcome of trial.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
That’s the optimal and least energy-using way, but we could use this opportunity to make some ideas is all I’m saying

Read full topic

I propose that we can simply remove NT with no replacement what so ever.

what would be a good second Day Ability for Noble that

item.title: (Yet Another) Noble Rework [For Less Confirmability]
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
I am referring to chill. Not Reap (but that is interesting. I didn’t know that)

Read full topic

item.title: (Yet Another) Noble Rework [For Less Confirmability]
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Ah thanks, I see. Noble Twin is indeed redundant and inferior to Political Pressure in almost all situations.

However, the last few times I have tried to use Political Pressure on a reaped person, it did not work. It simply wasted a use of the ability. I’m not sure if it would work on a chilled person either.

Read full topic

item.title: (Yet Another) Noble Rework [For Less Confirmability]
item.dc:creator: Marcus_Doodalee
item.description:
In fact Noble is stronger for that reason

Read full topic

item.title: (Yet Another) Noble Rework [For Less Confirmability]
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
“force one player to vote another and prevent further voting” Guilty and innocent is voting and is thus blocked

Read full topic

item.title: (Yet Another) Noble Rework [For Less Confirmability]
item.dc:creator: Marcus_Doodalee
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

Absolutely! Anytime that your faction controls the same or one less votes than an opposing faction you can use political pressure to get someone lynched when it would otherwise be impossible. In addition to that it interacts with other vote related abilitys such as Reaper and Hunter.

I was Noble in a cult game and got converted into a winning cult game, too bad I used CP on the bloody sellsword and outed myself in the process, but having a noble on your side in a kingless late-game is equal to having a king

Read full topic

item.title: (Yet Another) Noble Rework [For Less Confirmability]
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
wait PP blocks that player from also voting guilty or innocent? I guess I haven’t used it enough or payed enough attention

then NT is completely useless

Read full topic

item.title: (Yet Another) Noble Rework [For Less Confirmability]
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
That situation is winning with just PP and not NT. Force one Unseen to vote the MM. Vote him up with the Butler. Vote him out on trial since only 1 unseen can vote and 2 BD can vote. Butler occupys the assassin. Repeat next day. It is now 2 BD vs 1 Unseen

Read full topic

item.title: (Yet Another) Noble Rework [For Less Confirmability]

item.description:
3v2 noble+butler vs 3 Unseen

In a 1 v 2 situation, where Noble is the 1 and the 2 is Assassin + Unseen Convert,

oh wait Noble dies at night nevermind

Actually still no. At that point the extra vote is redundant because you have already flipped majority

Absolutely! Anytime that your faction controls the same or one less votes than an opposing faction you can use political pressure to get someone lynched when it would otherwise be impossible. In addition to that it interacts with other vote related abilitys such as Reaper and Hunter.

item.title: (Yet Another) Noble Rework [For Less Confirmability]
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
I’m not sure political pressure is significantly, if at all, more useful than noble twin. Could you demonstrate this?

item.title: (Yet Another) Noble Rework [For Less Confirmability]
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Exept that isn’t our only goal. We also want Ability’s that serve a meaningful purpose. Since political pressure accomplishes this but noble twins does not that means that noble twins is the one that should be removed.

Read full topic

item.description:
Exept you also removed the actualy useful ability in the process. Political Pressure is consistently useful even before taking into account proving potential. Noble twins is not even if you made it infinite votes
